member.name: T:CloudFoundry.Logyard.Client.ConnectionState
member.summary: Enumeration of possible connection states.

member.name: F:CloudFoundry.Logyard.Client.ConnectionState.None
member.summary: Websocket has no connection.

member.name: F:CloudFoundry.Logyard.Client.ConnectionState.Connecting
member.summary: Websocket is currently connecting.

member.name: F:CloudFoundry.Logyard.Client.ConnectionState.Open
member.summary: Websocket is open.

member.name: F:CloudFoundry.Logyard.Client.ConnectionState.Closing
member.summary: Websocket is currently closing.

member.name: F:CloudFoundry.Logyard.Client.ConnectionState.Closed
member.summary: Websocket is closed.

member.summary: An EventArgs class for error events.

member.name: P:CloudFoundry.Logyard.Client.ErrorEventArgs.Error
member.summary: Gets the error that occured while trying to communicate with the Logyard service.
member.value: An exception that describes the error.

member.summary: Exception class raised when something goes wrong while trying to communicate with Logyard.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The message that describes the error.

member.name: T:CloudFoundry.Logyard.Client.LogyardLog
member.summary: This is the Logyard client. To use it, you need a Logyard endpoint and an authorization token from UAA.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:CloudFoundry.Logyard.Client.LogyardLog.Finalize
member.summary: Finalizes an instance of the class.

member.name: M:CloudFoundry.Logyard.Client.LogyardLog.StopLogStream
member.summary: Stops the log stream.

member.name: M:CloudFoundry.Logyard.Client.LogyardLog.StartLogStream(System.String)
member.summary: Starts streaming logs from Logyard for the specified app. It streams for all instances of the app, without tailing.
member.param: The Cloud Foundry app unique identifier.

member.name: M:CloudFoundry.Logyard.Client.LogyardLog.StartLogStream(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Starts streaming logs from Logyard for the specified app, without tailing.
member.param: The Cloud Foundry app unique identifier.
The number of the app instance that will be the source of the log stream.

member.name: M:CloudFoundry.Logyard.Client.LogyardLog.StartLogStream(System.String,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Starts streaming logs from Logyard for the specified app, without tailing.
member.param: The Cloud Foundry app unique identifier.
The number of the app instance that will be the source of the log stream.
If set to true the application log files will be tailed.

member.name: M:CloudFoundry.Logyard.Client.LogyardLog.Dispose
member.summary: Performs application-defined tasks associated with freeing, releasing, or resetting unmanaged resources.

member.name: M:CloudFoundry.Logyard.Client.LogyardLog.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Releases unmanaged and - optionally - managed resources.
member.param: true to release both managed and unmanaged resources; false to release only unmanaged resources.

member.summary: Occurs when an error is received from Logyard.

member.summary: Occurs when a message is received from Logyard.

member.summary: Occurs when the Logyard stream is closed.

member.name: E:CloudFoundry.Logyard.Client.LogyardLog.StreamOpened

member.summary: Gets or sets the UAA authentication token.

member.summary: Gets the message that was received from Logyard.

member.summary: Class representing a log message coming from Logyard.

member.summary: Gets the name of the file the log message is comming from.

member.summary: Gets the text of the log message.

member.name: P:CloudFoundry.Logyard.Client.MessageValue.NodeId
member.summary: Gets an identifier for the node hosting the application.

member.summary: Gets the timestamp of the log message in unix time format.
